channel.title: Can some one help me design my website?
channel.description: Can some one help me design my website? I want my website look good srry im new to this makeing wbesite thing. plz post below if u can help.

item.title: Can some one help me design my website?
item.dc:creator: @OnlyOneRule OnlyOneRule
item.description:
@OnlyOneRule wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:25, topic:128746”][quote author=OnlyOneRule link=topic=179369.msg1644523#msg1644523 date=1186004945]
what opera?? i got opera 9 and it doesnt

edit:
Version 9.22
Build 8801
[/quote]

Opera Help

Help - Opera Help

Browse through the categorized sections in the left-side menu to learn more about the Opera browser. If you have additional questions or queries, check out the FAQ or forum pages, and stay informed with what's new in our Opera Blog page. 

Either way, the point was that you can easily do what you did in CSS3 with CSS2.[/quote]

kk ill check your idea out

item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx

@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“OnlyOneRule, post:24, topic:128746”]what opera?? i got opera 9 and it doesnt

edit:
Version 9.22
Build 8801[/quote]

Opera Help

Help - Opera Help

Browse through the categorized sections in the left-side menu to learn more about the Opera browser. If you have additional questions or queries, check out the FAQ or forum pages, and stay informed with what's new in our Opera Blog page. 

Either way, the point was that you can easily do what you did in CSS3 with CSS2.

item.title: Can some one help me design my website?
item.dc:creator: @OnlyOneRule OnlyOneRule
item.description:
@OnlyOneRule wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:23, topic:128746”][quote author=OnlyOneRule link=topic=179369.msg1644478#msg1644478 date=1186003823]
it is set for opera and safari but they dont have css3 yet… i got em all
[/quote]

Last time I checked, Presto ran CSS3 just as well as or better than Trident and Gecko, not to mention it did CSS2 better than any other layout engine. Presto, and hence, Opera, supports Opacity.[/quote]

what opera?? i got opera 9 and it doesnt

edit:
Version 9.22
Build 8801

Read full topic
item.source: Can some one help me design my website?

item.title: Can some one help me design my website?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

OnlyOneRule:

it is set for opera and safari but they dont have css3 yet… i got em all

Last time I checked, Presto ran CSS3 just as well as or better than Trident and Gecko, not to mention it did CSS2 better than any other layout engine. Presto, and hence, Opera, supports Opacity.

Read full topic
item.source: Can some one help me design my website?

item.title: Can some one help me design my website?
item.dc:creator: @OnlyOneRule OnlyOneRule
item.description:
@OnlyOneRule wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:21, topic:128746”][quote author=OnlyOneRule link=topic=179369.msg1644419#msg1644419 date=1186002806]
older browsers cant read css 3, meaning they cant use the opacity function, so i had to make rollover images, meaning the older browsers have to do twice as much loading, thats why i made a preload, so all the images can be saved into your temporary files on your computer and you wount have to wait for the images to rollover
[/quote]

Add Opera and Safari to your list then.

Don’t take this the wrong way, but javascript preloading may be a good way for an experimental site to get used to CSS3 functions, but an all-purpose site designed to reach the general population shouldn’t use that. Your opacity and moz-opacity functions could simply be exchanged for a sliding doors trick and Pixy hover effect. All your background gradients should be 1 px wide, and therefore no size restrictions should matter. Using the Pixy method ensures that buttons are preloaded, whatever small size they are. Furthermore, browser detection is very temperamental and incomplete.[/quote]

it is set for opera and safari but they dont have css3 yet… i got em all

Read full topic
item.source: Can some one help me design my website?

item.title: Can some one help me design my website?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

OnlyOneRule:

older browsers cant read css 3, meaning they cant use the opacity function, so i had to make rollover images, meaning the older browsers have to do twice as much loading, thats why i made a preload, so all the images can be saved into your temporary files on your computer and you wount have to wait for the images to rollover

Add Opera and Safari to your list then.

Don’t take this the wrong way, but javascript preloading may be a good way for an experimental site to get used to CSS3 functions, but an all-purpose site designed to reach the general population shouldn’t use that. Your opacity and moz-opacity functions could simply be exchanged for a sliding doors trick and Pixy hover effect. All your background gradients should be 1 px wide, and therefore no size restrictions should matter. Using the Pixy method ensures that buttons are preloaded, whatever small size they are. Furthermore, browser detection is very temperamental and incomplete.

Read full topic
item.source: Can some one help me design my website?

item.title: Can some one help me design my website?
item.dc:creator: @OnlyOneRule OnlyOneRule
item.description:
@OnlyOneRule wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:19, topic:128746”][quote author=OnlyOneRule link=topic=179369.msg1644393#msg1644393 date=1186001896]
that question aimed at me?
[/quote]

Yea, I wasn’t clear. I meant what was the loading bar doing there in the first place?[/quote]

older browsers cant read css 3, meaning they cant use the opacity function, so i had to make rollover images, meaning the older browsers have to do twice as much loading, thats why i made a preload, so all the images can be saved into your temporary files on your computer and you wount have to wait for the images to rollover

Read full topic

item.title: Can some one help me design my website?
item.dc:creator: @OnlyOneRule OnlyOneRule
item.description:
@OnlyOneRule wrote:

[quote=“Sick of Air, post:15, topic:128746”][quote author=OnlyOneRule link=topic=179369.msg1643651#msg1643651 date=1185974599]
it only loads because your using an older browser version…
[/quote]
Actually, I’m using the newest IE, and it only took like 5 seconds to load, but I’m saying anything that has a loading bar on it, I personally don’t like, because not everyone can see it, as legit said.[/quote]

yea thx for telling me, i found an error in my code now it works with firefox 1.5+ and IE7 without loading ^^

Read full topic

item.title: Can some one help me design my website?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Sick of Air:

Eh, whatever, I don’t like any template that has to load, and might not appear correctly on certain computers.

I gotta agree. According to w3schools, IE6 has roughly 30% of the market share. You can’t build sites that miss out on one third of your users.

Read full topic
